posts.name: Erdem Tellioglu
posts.cooked: What component do you use or what method do you follow to enclose the end parts of the shafts (the part after the bearing) ?

posts.name: Richard Wallace
posts.cooked: A washer, retained by a button head cap screw.

posts.name: Nyx
posts.cooked: Definitely my preferred method, but also should mention that E-clips exist. They’re more annoying to deal with and somewhat harder to quick change though if that’s a problem.

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: Everything and nothing, all at the same time

posts.custom_user_title: Everything and nothing, all at the same time

posts.name: Ankur Raghavan
posts.cooked: usually just make it a bit longer and put a shaft collar on each end. (we have a lot of shaft collars)

posts.name: Patrick Freivald
posts.cooked: Shaft collars are much more likely to come loose, and then Bad Things™ occur. I highly recommend the washer and button-head screw (with blue loctite) technique for ease, weight, geometry, and reliability.

posts.name: Richard Wallace
posts.cooked:
pfreivald:

(with blue loctite)

Yes, blue.  This is very important.

posts.name: Austin Plummer
posts.cooked: I agree 100% that screws and washers with Loctite work most of the time and that’s what I recommend in that application. But just a FYI we came out with these to fix some issues related to this. Robotics Shop | Plummer Industries

posts.name: Abi
posts.cooked:
My team has always used shaft collars, primarily because they’re easy to get your hands on, easily removable/adjustable, and they don’t rely on the shaft being tapped.

However, not all shaft collars are created equal: if it’s thin and has a very small set screw, trust me, you don’t want it. Here are my top picks:

High-Strength Clamping Shaft Collar from VEX Robotics Screenshot_20230112-125800 905×1076 82.3 KB

Screenshot_20230112-125800 905×1076 82.3 KB

Screenshot_20230112-125800 905×1076 82.3 KB

1/2" Hex Collar Clamps from Andymark Screenshot_20230112-125914 1440×1803 94.9 KB

Screenshot_20230112-125914 1440×1803 94.9 KB

Screenshot_20230112-125914 1440×1803 94.9 KB

They also come in different bores and sizes. Hope this helps!
